content: @Steve Howell how about floating or sticky buttons.

Ah. I should've given the background. The issue is #14274. In the organization permissions section, some of the option are way down, due to which the save setting button isn't visible. A probable solution might be making the button sticky, so that it's always visible. Even while scrolling.

We probably just need Tim Abbott to weigh in on this when we're less busy. There are many possible approaches here:

  • smaller subsections with their own save button
  • floating save buttons
  • don't require save...just do action as soon as you choose new option in dropdown (which moves the problem to making sure we don't put the your-change-has-taken-effect messaging above the fold)
  • put save button below widgets (having it above, like now, feels strange to me)
To be clear, I think it's still worth discussing options here, but I'm not going to make the decision here.

I think we do want to require save in "organization settings"; they're sufficiently sensitive settings that we want it to be hard to accidentally change them. I think probably doing additional subsections might make the most sense.
Is there a reason we don't have the Save button below all these options? Having to scroll up for a Save button feels counterintuitive.

Well, the design structure before we recently added like 5 new things to that bottom section was that the buttons would live on the subsection titles. It works quite well in the other parts of the "organization settings" area.
The design intent was that you should never have so much distance from the "Save" button for this type of problem to come up.
We just need to split "Other permissions". I can write out a proposed split in the issue.
yeah the same I was thinking about, the split can get the job done
OK just posted a reordering I feel good about.
should I go ahead and make those proposed changes?
Sure! Be sure to test carefully with reloading to make sure settings changes are actually saved properly for each and every moved element.
